author: Special Correspondent
text:
Two buses belonging to the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) were attached by the Fast Track court staff at the New Bus stand here on Tuesday, following non-payment of compensation of Rs. 20 lakh to the bereaved families of two persons who were killed in a road accident.

According to the prosecution, two persons, Mohan and Sekar, were fatally knocked down by a bus belonging to the Corporation at Parambur village near Kudumiyanmalai.

The incident happened on May 24. 2013.

The Fast Track Court ordered, in 2015, payment of a compensation of Rs. 10 lakh to each bereaved family. Although the order was issued a year ago, the TNSTC was yet to disburse it.

Hence the relatives filed execution petition praying for immediate disbursement of the compensation.

The Judge ordered attachment of two buses .

Buses in court

Accordingly, the court staff attached two buses and brought them to the court campus.
title: Two buses attached
